item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "It didn't matter in the end how old they had been, or that they were girls, but only that we had loved them, and that they hadn't heard us calling, still do not hear us, up here in the tree house, with our thinning hair and soft bellies, calling them out of those rooms where they went to be alone for all time, alone in suicide, which is deeper than death, and where we will never find the pieces to put them back together." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All you can do is hope for a pattern to emerge, and sometimes it never does. Still, with a plan, you only get the best you can imagine. I'd always hoped for something better than that." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "We can experience nothing but the present moment, live in no other second of time, and to understand this is as close as we can get to eternal life." -- P.D. James

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When did the future switch from being a promise to being a threat?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Richard Avedon
item.description: "A portrait is not a likeness. The moment an emotion or fact is transformed into a photograph it is no longer a fact but an opinion. There is no such thing as inaccuracy in a photograph. All photographs are accurate. None of them is the truth. " -- Richard Avedon

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "We felt the imprisonment of being a girl, the way it made your mind active and dreamy, and how you ended up knowing which colors went together. We knew that the girls were our twins, that we all existed in space like animals with identical skins, and that they knew everything about us though we couldn’t fathom them at all. We knew, finally, that the girls were really women in disguise, that they understood love and even death, and that our job was merely to create the noise that seemed to fascinate them." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Life seems but a quick succession of busy nothings." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "All the privilege I claim for my own sex (it is not a very enviable one: you need not covet it), is that of loving longest, when existence or when hope is gone!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I would die for you. But I won't live for you." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I am very interested and fascinated how everyone loves each other, but no one really likes each other." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I think that if I ever have kids, and they are upset, I won't tell them that people are starving in China or anything like that because it wouldn't change the fact that they were upset. And even if somebody else has it much worse, that doesn't really change the fact that you have what you have." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Look on every exit as being an entrance somewhere else." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Life is a gamble, at terrible odds. If it were a bet you wouldn’t take it." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "There must have been a moment, at the beginning, were we could have said -- no. But somehow we missed it. " -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "I shall have poetry in my life. And adventure. And love, love, love, above all. Love as there has never been in a play. Unbiddable, ungovernable, like a riot in the heart and nothing to be done, come ruin or rapture." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Whatever became of the moment when one first knew about death? There must have been one, a moment, in childhood, when it first occurred to you that you don't go on forever. It must have been shattering, stamped into one's memory. And yet I can't remember it. It never occurred to me at all. We must be born with an intuition of mortality. Before we know the word for it, before we know that there are words,out we come, bloodied and squalling...with the knowledge that for all the points of the compass, there's only one direction and time is its only measure." -Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Eternity is a terrible thought. I mean, where's it going to end?" -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: " ...reality, the name we give to the common experience." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "There's nothing to be gained from passive observance, the simple documenting of conditions, because, at its core, it sets a bad example. Every time something is observed and not fixed, or when one has a chance to give in some way and does not, there is a lie being told, the same lie we all know by heart but which needn't be reiterated." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by John Knowles
item.description: "I felt that I was not, never had been and never would be a living part of this overpoweringly solid and deeply meaningful world around me." -- John Knowles

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Only half a page left now. Shall I fill it with 'I love you, I love you'-- like father's page of cats on the mat? No. Even a broken heart doesn't warrant a waste of good paper." -- Dodie Smith
